Keywords: Brute , Dark Knights , Injustice Society , Monster , Past , Secret Six , Warrior
Real Name: Unknown
Special Powers
SECRET SIX: Outwit. // Sky Tyrant modifies attack +1 when attacking 1+ characters with a shared keyword. // If there are 6+ friendly characters with the Secret Six keyword on your force, opposing characters can't use Protected: Outwit or SAFEGUARD: Outwit.
I'LL RACK UP SO MUCH BLOOD, WE'LL REINCARNATE FOREVER: When Sky Tyrant KO's an opposing character, give him a Reincarnation token. // When Sky Tyrant would be KO'd, you may instead remove a Reincarnation token and turn him to click #7.
SKY TYRANT FLIES AGAIN!: Flurry. Charge, but do not halve Speed. // When Sky Tyrant hits, after resolutions he may move up to half his speed value using [Improved Movement: Characters].

Best to ask in the rules forum but yes he comes back. He isn't avoiding damage. If he has a token when he would be ko'd meaning he took clix he would remove the token and come back. Pulse wave would be the only common way to ko him and disallow the use of a Reincarnation token.

April 29, 2021
Hellboy the Bellboy
@Macgyver2506 I have to disagree with you. It doesn't have to say "every time he hits", "when he hits" is equivalent. Vulture prime's wording was "when he KOs" and he could keep going as long as he met that requirement, Sky Tyrant should be no different with hits. I would agree with you if the instance was Quake (1 hit multiple targets) but with Flurry it is two separate instances of a hit.
April 29, 2021
MacGyver2506
[QUOTE=Hellboy the Bellboy] Give him Waldo Arms for that potential free attack. Charge in with 12, hit twice, move 12 to another victim, free attack, move 6.[/QUOTE] Even with flurry, he wouldn't move 12. The criteria specifies if he hits, not per time he hits. It would go flurry, move up to 6 (if one or both attacks hit), Waldo arms possible attack (if you rolled a 5-6 at the beginning of your turn), then move another 6 (if the waldo arms attack landed)

April 25, 2021
Hellboy the Bellboy
@deathtrooper744 More like move 12, smack twice, then move for 6 twice. His move after is contingent on hits, so he could move 12 after hitting twice with that flurry.
March 23, 2021
deathtrooper744
[QUOTE=thugit;12123919]“We’re benching HSS so we can make other powers work even more abusively than HSS!” Move 12 squares, Flurry, then move 6 squares away... Seems like 12 move HSS would’ve been less imposing.[/QUOTE] Don't forget Outwit, Exploit and BCF for even more craziness now that powers combo much more powerfully together. Move in 12 squares, smack somebody for 6 penetrating damage and do it twice, and then move out 6 squares. Extremely strong on offense, but his middleing defensive stats stop him from being completely OP. All in all though, a very cool character
